etymology.description: 亼 (roof) + 戶 (door) + 口 (pit for storing grain) -> depiction of a granary -> variant glyph for storehouse
etymology.interpretation: The character 倉(倉) (cāng, "storehouse") originally depicted a granary with components representing a roof, a door, and a storage pit. This construction is intuitive for the concept of a structure designed for storing goods. The simplified version, 仓, stems from this traditional form.
etymology.simplification: The traditional character 倉(倉) (cāng, "storehouse") was simplified to 仓 by omitting the complexity of the components and achieving a simpler form.

examples.chinese: 他把粮食存放在仓里(他把糧食存放在倉裡)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ liángshí cúnfàng zài cāng lǐ.
examples.english: He stores the grains in the storehouse.

examples.chinese: 旧仓被改造成博物馆(舊倉被改造成博物館)。
examples.pinyin: Jiù cāng bèi gǎizào chéng bówùguǎn.
examples.english: The old storehouse has been converted into a museum.

examples.chinese: 村民常常从仓拿出储备粮(村民常常從倉拿出儲備糧)。
examples.pinyin: Cūnmín chángcháng cóng cāng ná chū chǔbèi liáng.
examples.english: The villagers often take out the stored grains from the storehouse.
